contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Magazine |title = Datenschleuder |image_file = Datenschleuder.png |image_size = 180px |image_caption = Issue 91 |editor = |editor_title = Editor |previous_editor = |staff_writer = |frequency = No set frequency |circulation = |category = Hacking |company = |publisher = |firstdate = 1984 |country = Germany |based = |language = German |website = [http://ds.ccc.de/ ds.ccc.de] |issn = 0930-1054 }} '''''{{lang|de|Die Datenschleuder. Das wissenschaftliche Fachblatt für Datenreisende}}''''', literally translated as ''The Data Slingshot: The scientific trade journal for data voyagers'', is a German [[hacker magazine]] that is published at irregular intervals by the [[Chaos Computer Club]] (CCC). Topics include primarily political and technical aspects of the [[Digitizing|digital]] world ([[freedom of information]], data [[privacy]] (data protection), [[closed-circuit television]], personal [[privacy]] (personal rights), [[cryptography]] and many more). ''{{lang|de|Die Datenschleuder}}'' was first published in 1984 and also can be subscribed to independently of a membership in the CCC. All (more than 90) back issues are freely available on the [[Internet]] as well.<ref> [http://ds.ccc.de/download.html Various Datenschleuder issues in PDF format]</ref> The current print paper format is ''DIN A5'' as per [[ISO 216]]. Its editorial process is carried out over the [[Internet]], while the magazine itself is printed in and distributed from [[Berlin]]. Issue #92 from March 2008 contained a reproduction of a [[fingerprint]] from [[Wolfgang Schäuble]], the interior minister of Germany at the time.<ref>[http://www.spiegel.de/netzwelt/web/0,1518,544203,00.html „Hacker-Club veröffentlicht Schäubles Fingerabdruck“] Spiegel Online</ref> The US [[phreaking]] magazine [[TAP (magazine)|TAP – The Youth International Party Line (YIPL)]] (founded in 1971) has been described as a model for Datenschleuder.<ref>„[http://www.spiegel.tv/filme/andreas-bogk/ Alte Schule: Andreas Bogk]“ Interview by Philip Banse, [[Der Spiegel|Spiegel]] TV/[[dctp]], 2012 (from 6:53)</ref> ==See also== * [[Chaos Computer Club]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://ds.ccc.de/ Datenschleuder website, German (ISSN: 0930-1054)] [[Category:German computer magazines]] [[Category:Hacker magazines]]
